thread.title: Did Abbott jinx 2 Texas MLB teams in one tweet?
thread.title_full: Did Abbott jinx 2 Texas MLB teams in one tweet?

title: Did Abbott jinx 2 Texas MLB teams in one tweet?
text:
Did Gov. Abbott's office jinx 2 Texas MLB teams in one tweet? It ain't over 'til it's over. Post to Facebook Did Gov. Abbott's office jinx 2 Texas MLB teams in one tweet? It ain't over 'til it's over.  //on.wfaa.com/1RDfNym   Did Gov. Abbott's office jinx 2 Texas MLB teams in one tweet? Landon Haaf, WFAA Sports 5:07 p.m. CDT October 12, 2015 Greg Abbott 
It ain't over 'til it's over. 
That didn't quite resonate in the Texas governor's office on Monday. 
The verified Twitter account of Gov. Greg Abbott's office ( @GovAbbott ) sent out a tweet congratulating the Houston Astros on a win over the Kansas City Royals in their American League Division Series. 
Houston held a four-run lead in the eighth inning with a chance to clinch the series. Whoops. @GovAbbott tweeted the @astros beat the @royals , but the game wasn't over yet! Now the Royals are winning! pic.twitter.com/6FTp73XOT1 — Ryan Wood (@RyanWoodDFW) October 12, 2015 
The Royals, of course, would score seven runs in the final two innings to stun the AL West runners-up and force a Game 5 in the series. 
Kansas City recorded five consecutive base hits followed by an RBI groundout to start the eighth-inning rally in Houston. 
The tweet from Abbott's office has since been deleted. 
Astros fans certainly have reason to be salty about the governor's tweet. But fans of Texas' other team could also have a beef with him. 
The tweet, sent just five minutes before the first pitch of the Texas Rangers' Game 4 against Toronto, wished for an all-Texas ALCS. 
Things didn't get off to a good start in Arlington, as the Rangers -- who also had a chance to seal an ALDS win -- fell into a 7-0 hole in the first three innings. 
The Rangers' downfall may not be all Abbott's fault, though. Lil' B, a rapper also known as the "Based God," sent his good vibes to the Blue Jays on Twitter before Toronto's Game 3 win in Arlington. 
His tweet granted the request of Toronto city councilman Norm Kelly to "bless" the Jays. @norm @BlueJays hey norm your request is granted and remember I love you and Canada! That's number one! - Lil B — Lil B THE BASEDGOD (@LILBTHEBASEDGOD) October 11, 2015 
When the governor AND strangely-prophetic rappers are throwing out jinxes, it's guaranteed to be tough sledding. 
Abbott later tweeted from his personal account ( @GregAbott_TX ) that users should unfollow the account that sent the preemptive tweet, and instead follow his personal account for "no predictions. Just support." Read or Share this story: http://on.wfaa.com/1RDfNym TOP VIDEOS
